legendaryGroup.name: COMAberrationLegendaryLairActionsGeyadroneDihada
lairActions: On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), Geyadrone can take a lair action to cause one of the following effects:

items: The lair is a swirling miasma of illusions and shadows, causing creatures to second guess their instincts. Each creature within 60 ft of Geyadrone must succeed a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or suffer the effects of the spell confusion.

Geyadrone summons a mind-warping vision of the far realm to erupt from a point she can see within 120 feet of her. Each creature within 20 feet of that point must succeed a DC 15 Wisdom saving through or gain a Dementia Counter.

monster.name: Geyadrone Dihada

trait.name: Aura of Dementia
entries: Any creature that starts its turn within 30 feet of Geyadrone must succeed on a {@dc 21} Wisdom saving throw or gain 1 dementia counter (see sidebar).

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/day)
entries: If Geyadrone fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: Geyadrone has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Metamagic (1/turn)
entries: When the sorcerer casts a spell of 1st level or higher, it can apply one of the following metamagic options to that spell.

items: {@b Empowered Spell.} When Geyadrone rolls damage for a spell, she can reroll up to 7 damage dice of her choice. She must use the new rolls.
{@b Heightened Spell.} One creature affected by the spell (Geyadrone's choice) has disadvantage on the first saving throw it must make against the spell's effects.
{@b Seeking Spell.} If Geyadrone makes an attack roll for a spell and misses, She can reroll the {@dice d20}, and must use the new roll.
{@b Twinned Spell.} If the spell targets only one creature and doesn't have a range of self, Geyadrone can target a second creature in range with the same spell.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Geyadrone is a 20th-level spellcaster. Her spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 21}, +13 to hit with spell attacks). Geyadrone has the following sorcerer spells prepared:

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Geyadrone makes four arcane blast or two tentacle lash attacks.

action.name: Arcane Blast
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 13} to hit, range 120 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 2d10 + 7}) force damage.

action.name: Tentacle Lash
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d10 + 4}) bludgeoning damage, plus 13 ({@damage 3d8}) psychic damage.

action.name: Corrupt Consciousness {@recharge}
entries: Geyadrone targets a creature within 30 feet of her that has at least one dementia counter that she can see. The creature must succeed a Wisdom saving throw ({@dc 21}) or become {@condition charmed} by Geyadrone. While {@condition charmed}, Geyadrone can use her bonus action to take command of the creature for their next turn.

On their turn, Geyadrone uses her psionic power to overwhelm the creature's system, pushing them beyond their normal physical limit; represented as though the creature is under the effect of the haste spell.
A creature can attempt to regain control of their mind with a successful Wisdom saving throw ({@dc 21}) at the end of their turn.

action.name: Warping Implosion {@recharge 5}
entries: Geyadrone can unleash her aberrant power as a space-warping anomaly. As an action, she can teleport to an unoccupied space she can see within 120 feet of her. Immediately after she disappears, each creature within 30 feet of the space she left must make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 3d10} force damage and is pulled straight toward the space she left, ending in an unoccupied space as close to her former space as possible. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't pulled.

bonus.name: Dihada's Guile
entries: As a bonus action, Geyadrone can expend one
spell slot to regain 4 ({@dice 1d8}) hit points per level of spell slot
extended.

legendaryHeader: Geyadrone can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. Geyadrone regains spent legendary actions at the start of her turn.

legendary.name: Arcane Blast
entries: Geyadrone makes an Arcane Blast attack.

legendary.name: Teleportation Surprise (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Geyadrone teleports to an unoccupied space she can see within 30 feet of her and can make a Tentacle Lash attack.

legendary.name: Psychic Lash (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: Geyadrone targets a creature she can see within 30 feet of her and psychically lashes at that creature's mind. The target must succeed on a {@dc 21} Wisdom saving throw or take 36 ({@damage 8d8}) psychic damage and be {@condition stunned} until the start of its next turn.

{@link Geyadrone Dihada|https://www.reddit.com/r/dndmonsters/comments/q92i02/geyadrone_dihada_a_truly_horrifying_sorcerer/} and {@link Geyadrone PDF|https://drive.google.com/file/d/1YkV9nQq-8D6FIAKMespfPCvY8YHOtCE4/view}
{@i Your argument as to why I should spare you lacked substance. Now, so do you.}
{@i Geyadrone Dihada}

Geyadrone Dihada is an ancient, otherworldly entity with an insatiable and unquenchable thirst for power. She relishes in subjugating the powerful for her own nefarious schemes, as well as corrupting those that contain potential that she may mold and corrupt so that they may serve her schemes.

Her schemes are convoluted and it is often impossible for anyone but her to realize the full depth of her depravity. In the case of Dakkon, the master blacksmith, she commissioned him to forge the Black Blade, a legendary soul-drinking sword under the promise that god-like power would be bestowed upon him. Dakkon toiled each day for 10 years only to be double-crossed and have his soul imprisoned within the blade by Geyadrone upon the sword's completion. For years Dakkon wandered the planes, wondering why she would betray him for seemingly no purpose other than to make him hate her.

After many years she would use another mortal to wield the Black Blade and summon Dakkon. When Dakkon attacked, Geyadrone summoned two elder dragons to fight in her stead. When Dakkon emerged Victorious, Geyadrone absorbed the elder dragon's life force and soul to empower herself.
{@b Using Geyadrone in your Campaign}

Geyadrone can easily accept the role of a master manipulator in your world. She may approach your adventurers much like Dakkon, promising unlimited power for completion of a quest only to be betrayed by her once they complete the task.

Imagine a weakened Geyadrone approaching the party to retrieve an artifact that can be used to unlock a portal to another plane, just so that the denizens of the plane can attack your world. Your adventurers can fight to keep the interlopers at bay only to later find that the slaughter brought on by this war only succeeds in empowering Geyadrone so that she can return in her true form and attack the party herself.
{@b Roleplaying Geyadrone}

Geyadrone believes that she is destined for power and dominance over those she believes are inferior to her (Which is everyone). She will use anyone if it grants her even a modicum of of an advantage on a situation. She would just as soon set two nations at war than to help strengthen relations between two other nations if it means that she can exploit the political landscape to gain something that she desires.
{@i Personality Traits.} I always keep my word, Except when breaking it grants me a greater advantage.
{@i Ideals.} When setting a snare, success depends not on the quality of the trap, but the quality of the bait.
{@i Bonds.} You can't even fathom the depths of your own insignificance.
{@i Flaws.} Only someone that can compete with my level of genius can understand my true intentions. Luckily, no one comes close.
{@b Geyadrone's Lair}
The Unholy Citadel is Geyadrone's fortress of bone that traverses the land on spider-like legs. Geyadrone's lair is as maddening as she is.

entries.name: Dementia Counters
entries: Being close to Geyadrone Dihada is a dangerous experience.

Her ability to bend and break the will of her opponents permeates the very air around her. To be in Geyadrone's vicinity is to be barraged with a constant and indefatigable psychic onslaught. Only the strongest of wills can defend themselves from the dirge of psychic noise, and even this weakens over time.

Creatures that fall prey to her Aura of Dementia will gain a Dementia Counter. Each Dementia Counter befuddles the mind, lowering their will making it easier for Geyadrone to impart hers on the creature, and provoking them into an uncontrollable frenzy. Each corruption counter on a creature imparts the follows effects:

items: {@b Frenzied Mind.} Each melee attack the creature makes gains a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls per counter.
{@b Reckless Attacks.} Attacks made by the creature are made at advantage, but attack rolls against the creature also have advantage.
{@b Befuddled Mind.} The creature takes a cumulative -2 penalty on all Wisdom, Intelligence or Charisma saving throws per dementia counter.
{@b Psychic Feedback.} Creatures take an additional 5 (1d10) psychic damage from spells or attack rolls made by Geyadrone that hit.
{@b Psionic Protection.} Geyadrone uses the creatures mind to lessen damage she takes from them. She gains resistance to all damage taken from creatures that have a corruption counter on them.

entries: A creature with a dementia counter can attempt to remove a dementia counter with a successful Wisdom saving throw (DC21). A dementia counter may also be removed by the lesser restoration, remove curse, dispel evil and good, or other similar magic (DM Discretion).
